info.name: Anterior spinal artery
info.description: The anterior spinal artery originates as a branch from each of the vertebral arteries at the level of the medulla; these branches then join to form a single vessel which travels caudally in the ventral median fissure of the spinal cord. Along with tributaries from the radicular arteries, it supplies the anterior 2/3rds of the spinal cord.
info.item: /Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/1 Sacral cord, middle
/Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/2 Lumbar cord, middle
/Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/9 Cord-Medulla Junction
